title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-7.4 - Specimen and sample unit
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-7.4 - Specimen and sample unit

State Regulations
(a) Specimen. The specimen shall be taken from the bag as shown in Figure I and
shall have a finished size of 12 inches x 14 inches. In the event that it is
impossible to cut an actual sample from a bag due to its construction, a 12
inch x 28 inch facsimile may be constructed and folded. All components shall be
used in their correct positions and amount. (b) Sample unit. A sample unit shall consist
of ten specimens, five to be subjected to three cycles of washing following the
procedures recommended by the manufacturer. Samples should be dried between
washings and thoroughly dry before testing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
80-7.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
